quotes.quote: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
Hold a true friend with both your hands.
A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
The wise man learns more from his enemies than the fool does from his friends.
Misfortune tests the sincerity of friends.
The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.

Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
Who is mighty? He who makes an enemy into a friend.
One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
Keep your friendships in repair.
Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing
Most of us don't need a psychiatric therapist as much as a friend to be silly with.
The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
To have a few amazing friends on this side of eternity, this sometimes grotesque amusement park, is the greatest joy.
A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad.
I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.
Friends are God's way of taking care of us.
A true friend is the best Possession.
Friendship increases by visiting friends but visiting seldom.
Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
Keep your friends close, your enemies even closer.
Make a friend when you don't need one.
No better relation than a prudent and faithful friend.
One enemy is too many and a hundred friends too few.
Little friends may prove great friends.
Strangers are just friends waiting to happen.
The best mirror is an old friend.
The road to a friend's house is never long.
The wolf and the dog agree, at the expense of the goat which together they eat.
When I eat your bread, I sing your song.
You never really know your friends from your enemies until the ice breaks.
There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .
Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
Life is an awful, ugly place to not have a best friend.
It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
Friendship isn't a big thing it's a million little things.

In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
There are some people in life that make you laugh a little louder, smile a little bigger, and live just a little bit better.
Good friends help you find important things when you have lost them. Your smile, you hope, and your courage.
True friendship comes when the silence between two people is comfortable.
Friendship consists in forgetting what one gives and remembering what one receives.
I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.
To find a friend one must close one eye. To keep him—close two.
[Friends are] God’s apology for relations.
It may be more difficult to make new friends as you get older but it is some consolation to know how easy it is to lose them when you are young.
Thank you for being a friend / Traveled down a road and back again / Your heart is true, you're a pal and a confidant.

What would you think if I sang out of tune? / Would you stand up and walk out on me? / Lend me your ears and I'll sing you a song / And I'll try not to sing out of key / Oh, I get by with a little help from my friends.

quotes.cite: Burt Bacharach and Carole Bayer Sager
quotes.quote: For good times and bad times / I'll be on your side forever more / That's what friends are for.

Two sturdy oaks I mean, which side by side, / Withstand the winter's storm, / And spite of wind and tide, / Grow up the meadow's pride, / For both are strong / Above they barely touch, but undermined / Down to their deepest source, / Admiring you shall find / Their roots are intertwined / Insep'rably.
I was angry with my friend: / I told my wrath, my wrath did end. / I was angry with my foe: / I told it not, my wrath did grow.
It’s not that diamonds are a girl’s best friend, but it’s your best friends who are your diamonds.
There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature.
What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
Growing apart doesn’t change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I’m glad for that.
Find a group of people who challenge and inspire you; spend a lot of time with them, and it will change your life.
Some people arrive and make such a beautiful impact on your life, you can barely remember what life was like without them.
A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
A good friend can tell you what is the matter with you in a minute. He may not seem such a good friend after telling.
For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.
An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
Friends should be like books, few, but hand-selected.
Friendship is like a glass ornament, once it is broken it can rarely be put back together exactly the same way.
Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.
What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
A friend knows the song in my heart and sings it to me when my memory fails.
Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
There is one friend in the life of each of us who seems not a separate person, however dear and beloved, but an expansion, an interpretation, of one’s self, the very meaning of one’s soul.
Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.
True friends don’t judge each other, they judge other people together.
I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
The best time to make friends is before you need them.
The real test of friendship is can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?
A friend can tell you things you don’t want to tell yourself.
It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
Nothing makes the earth seem so spacious as to have friends at a distance; they make the latitudes and longitudes.
True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
There’s not a word yet for old friends who’ve just met.
In prosperity our friends know us; in adversity we know our friends.
In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter and sharing of pleasure. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
A single rose can be my garden… a single friend, my world.
A good friend is a connection to life a tie to the past, a road to the future, the key to sanity in a totally insane world.
Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
Friendship improves happiness, and abates misery, by doubling our joys, and dividing our grief.
In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
Never forget that a true friend is someone who understands your past, believes in your future, and accepts you just the way you are.
Ultimately the bond of all companionship, whether in marriage or in friendship, is conversation.
Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend’s success.
There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
A friendship that can end never really began.
I value the friend who for me finds time on his calendar, but I cherish the friend who for me does not consult his calendar.
A friend is a gift you give yourself.
If you have two friends in your lifetime, you’re lucky. If you have one good friend, you’re more than lucky.
The great thing about new friends is that they bring new energy to your soul.
Life is partly what we make it, and partly what it is made by the friends we choose.
Don’t make friends who are comfortable to be with. Make friends who will force you to lever yourself up.
Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.
If you live to be 100, I hope I live to be 100 minus 1 day, so I never have to live without you.
